description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the dataset.

risk_data_type.title: Risk data type
risk_data_type.description: The type of risk data included in the dataset, from the closed [risk data type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#risk-data-type).

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The entity responsible for making the dataset available.

version.title: Dataset version
version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of the dataset.

purpose.title: Dataset purpose
purpose.description: The purpose for which the dataset was created.

project.title: Project title
project.description: The name of the project that produced the dataset.

referenced_by.title: Referenced by
referenced_by.description: Related resources, such as publications, that reference, cite, or otherwise point to the dataset.

spatial.title: Spatial coverage
spatial.description: The geographical area covered by the dataset.

license.title: License
license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the dataset, taken from the open [license codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#license). A Public Domain Dedication or [Open Definition Conformant](https://opendefinition.org/licenses/) license is recommended. Documents linked from this file may be under other license conditions.

contact_point.title: Contact point
contact_point.description: Contact information for the maintainer of the dataset.

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: The entity responsible for producing the dataset.

attributions.title: Attributions
attributions.description: Information about entities and their roles in relation to the dataset.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Information about the resources included in the dataset.

hazard.title: hazard
hazard.description: Information about a modelled physical hazard phenomenon.

exposure.title: Exposure dataset metadata
exposure.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the situation of people, infrastructure, housing, production capacities and other tangible human assets located in hazard-prone areas.

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure category codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#exposure_category).

taxonomy_code.description: Taxonomy code to which function applies

country_tranferability.description: ISOa3 list of countries in which the model could be applied

local_applicability.description: Area within a country or region to wich the model specifically applies

transferability_notes.description: Details about applicability to different areas

calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the function

f_relationship.description: Type of relationship: Mathematical or Discrete

analysis_details.description: Description of analysis that produced the function

n_events.description: Number of events the function has been built on

n_assets.description: Number of assets the function has been built on

is_edp_thre.description: Is the damage scale is associated to an engineered-design parameter threshold?

is_dm_factor.description: Is the damage scale is associated to a damage factor?

is_casualties.description: Is the damage scale is associated to a casualties estimation?

is_downtime.description: Is the damage scale is associated to a downtime estimation (e.g. service interruption)?

time_start.description: The time at which the modelled scenario(s) starts [ISO 8601 format]

time_end.description: The time at which the modelled scenario(s) ends [ISO 8601 format]

time_year.description: General reference year to which the scenario refers to (e.g. '2050')

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure category codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#exposure_category).

return_period.description: Probability of occurrence expressed as return periods list (10, 100, 1000) or range (10-1000)

calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of this event

Exposure.title: Exposure
Exposure.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the situation of people, infrastructure, housing, production capacities and other tangible human assets located in hazard-prone areas.

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure category codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#exposure_category).

taxonomy.title: Exposure taxonomy scheme
taxonomy.description: The name of the taxonomy scheme used to create descriptive individual asset feature strings within the dataset.

cost.title: Asset cost
cost.description: The exposure costs associated with specific elements of assets detailed in the dataset.

Cost.title: Asset cost
Cost.description: The costs associated with specific elements of assets detailed in the dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this cost.

type.title: Cost type
type.description: The type of the cost, from the closed [cost type codelist] (https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#cost_type).

unit.title: Cost unit
unit.description: The unit in which the cost is specified, from the closed [currency codelist] (https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#currency).

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: An individual file or other form of data. Resources can be fully informationally equivalent, such as CSV and JSON serializations of the same data. Resources can also have different levels of fidelity, such as a CSV file and a graphical representation of the data within the file. Resources can also differ in other aspects, such as the temporal coverage of each resource.

id.title: Resource identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this resource.

media_type.title: Media type
media_type.description: The media type of the resource, from the open [media_type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#media_type). For example a custom binary file has media_type 'application/octet-stream. A geojson file has the media_type 'application/geo+json'.

format.title: Format
format.description: A human-readable descripton of the file format of the resource, taken from the open [data formats codelist]((https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#data_formats).

spatial_resolution.title: Spatial resolution
spatial_resolution.description: The minimum spatial separation resolvable in the resource, measured in meters.

coordinate_system.title: Reference coordinate system
coordinate_system.description: The reference co-ordinate system of the dataset version, using the [EPSG codelist](https://epsg.org).

url.title: Url
url.description: The web address the dataset version can be downloaded from.

temporal.title: Temporal coverage
temporal.description: The period of time covered by this resource.

Related_resource.title: Related resource
Related_resource.description: A related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to a dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the related resource.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name or title of the resource.

authorNames.title: Author names
authorNames.description: The names of the authors of the resource.

datePublished.title: Publication date
datePublished.description: The date that the resource was first published.

url.title: URL
url.description: The uniform resource locator for the resource, e.g. the web address at which the resource can be accessed.

doi.title: Digital object identifier
doi.description: The digital object identifier for the resource.

start.title: Start
start.description: The start of the period. A date (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended. However, year-months (YYYY-MM) and years (YYYY) are supported.

end.title: End date
end.description: The end of the period. A date (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended. However, year-months (YYYY-MM) and years (YYYY) are supported.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The duration of the period in ISO 8601 duration format, e.g. 'P50Y' for 50 years

email.title: Email address
email.description: An email address for the entity.

url.title: URL
url.description: A URL associated with the entity.

Attribution.title: Attribution
Attribution.description: A qualified relation between an entity and a dataset.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the attribution.

entity.title: Entity
entity.description: An entity with a role in relation to the dataset.

role.title: Role
role.description: The entity's role in relation to the dataset, using the open [roles codelist] (https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#roles).

countries.title: Countries
countries.description: The countries covered by the geographical area, from the closed [country codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#country).

gazetteerEntries.title: Gazetteer entries
gazetteerEntries.description: Entries from geographical indices or directories describing the geographical area. This field should be used to describe subnational coverage. Use of ISO 3166-2 is recommended.

bbox.title: Bounding box
bbox.description: A geographic bounding box delimiting the geographical area.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: A set of coordinates denoting the vertices of the geographical area.

centroid.title: Centroid
centroid.description: The coordinates of the centre of the geographical area.

Gazetteer_entry.title: Gazetteer entry
Gazetteer_entry.description: An entry from a geographical index or directory describing a geographical area.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: An identifier drawn from the gazetteer identified in `.scheme`.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The gazetteer from which the entry is drawn, from the open [location gazetteers codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#location_gazetteers).

description.title: Description
description.description: A description for the gazetteer entry.

uri.title: Uniform resource locator
uri.description: A URI for the gazetteer entry.

Geometry.title: Geometry
Geometry.description: A set of coordinates denoting the vertices of the geographical area.

type.title: Type
type.description: The GeoJSON geometry type that is described by `.coordinates`, from the closed [geometry_type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#geometry_type).

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: One or more GeoJSON positions according to the GeoJSON geometry type defined in `.type`.

Hazard.title: hazard
Hazard.description: Information about a modelled physical hazard phenomenon.

Event_set.title: Event set
Event_set.description: Information about a set of hazard events.

id.title: Event set identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this event set.

hazard_type.title: Hazard type
hazard_type.description: The main type of hazard phenomena in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard type codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#hazard_type).

analysis_type.title: Analysis type
analysis_type.description: The type of analysis used by the hazard model, from the closed [analysis type codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists#analysis_type).

frequency_distribution.title: Frequency distribution
frequency_distribution.description: The frequency distribution assumed for the occurrence of events over a multi-year timeline, from the [frequency distribution codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#frequency_distribution).

seasonality.title: Seasonality distribution
seasonality.description: The seasonality distribution assumed for the occurrence of events across a calendar year, from the [seasonality distribution codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#seasonality_distribution)

calculation_method.title: Calculation Method
calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the event set in the modelled scenario(s), taken from the closed [data calculation type codelist](https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists/#data_calculation_type).

event_count.title: Event count
event_count.description: The number of events contained in the event set. You should only use this field when details of individual events are not included in the RDLS metadata.

occurrence_range.title: Occurrence range
occurrence_range.description: A summary of the probabilistic occurrence scenarios that are included in the event set. This field should only be used if `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

spatial.title: Spatial coverage
spatial.description: The geographical area covered by the the hazard analysis in this event set.

process_type.title: Process type
process_type.description: Type of hazard process modelled, from the closed [process type codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#process_type).

temporal.title: Temporal coverage
temporal.description: The period of time covered by this event set.

events.title: Events
events.description: The events in this event set.

id.title: Event identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this event.

disaster_identifier.title: Disaster identifier
disaster_identifier.description: The GLIDE number associated with this disaster event. A globally unique identifier for the event, assigned by [GLIDE](https://www.glidenumber.net/glide/public/search/search.jsp).

calculation_method.title: Model calculation method
calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the event in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [data calculation type codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists#data_calculation_type).

process_type.title: Process type
process_type.description: Type of hazard process modelled, from the closed [process type codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists.html#process_type).

occurrence.title: Occurrence
occurrence.description: The frequency or likelihood of the event happening within a given timeframe.

trigger_hazard_type.description: Hazard type that triggered the event

trigger_process_type.description: Process type that triggered the event

description.description: Provides additional information about this specific event

Occurrence.title: Occurrence
Occurrence.description: The frequency or likelihood of an event happening within a given timeframe.

probabilistic.title: Probabilistic frequency
probabilistic.description: How often the event is expected to occur. Can be Return Period and/or probability. Both fields are provided to allow entry of return period (most common term used across all hazards) and/or probability, which is commonly used for seismic hazard. Probability commonly refers to a probability within 1 year or 50 years, but may be relative to any duration - when `probability` is used, `span` must be specified. This object must only be used if `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

empirical.title: Empirical
empirical.description: The period of time over which the event occurred. This field should only be used if `event_set.analysis_type` = 'empirical'

Probabilistic.title: Probabilistic frequency
Probabilistic.description: How often the event is expected to occur. Can be Return Period and/or probability. Both fields are provided to allow entry of return period (most common term used across all hazards) and/or probability, which is commonly used for seismic hazard. Probability commonly refers to a probability within 1 year or 50 years, but may be relative to any duration - when `probability` is used, `span` must be specified. This object must only be used if `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

return_period.title: Return period
return_period.description: The event return period (or recurrence interval); the estimated average time between events. Expressed as the denominator of '1/n', e.g. '10' for a 1-in-10 year return period etc.

event_rate.title: Event rate
event_rate.description: The average number of occurrences of the event within a given year. This is the reciprocal of the return period, related by event_set.frequency_distribution.

probability.title: Probability
probability.description: The likelihood of the event occurring in a given time period.

Probability.title: probability
Probability.description: The likelihood of the event occurring in a given time period.

value.title: Probability value
value.description: The probability of the event occurring during the time period specified in `.span`, expressed as a number between 0 and 1, e.g. 0.1 represents a 10% likelihood of the event occuring.

span.title: Probability span
span.description: The length in years of the period in which the event is likely to occur with the probability specified in `.value`.

Footprint.title: Footprint
Footprint.description: Information about a single hazard event footprint showing spatial distribution of hazard intensity.

id.title: Footprint identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this footprint

intensity_measure.title: Hazard intensity measurement
intensity_measure.description: The measurement unit used in the footprint, from the open [IMT codelist]https://rdl-standard.readthedocs.io/en/{{version}}/reference/codelists#IMT). This is typically a measurement of intensity but can also take other forms, e.g. spectral velocity or flood water depth.

data_uncertainty.title: Data uncertainty
data_uncertainty.description: Details of the uncertainty of the footprint that should be taken into account when interpreting the data.
